text: Aseptic meningitis occurs when there are signs of meningitis. However, when a sample of brain fluid is taken, bacteria do not grow. This condition is often treatable. In many cases, recovery takes 7â€“10 days. Meningitis happens when the brain's lining becomes inflamed. This lining is called the meninges. == Cause == *Viral infection due to: **Enterovirus (e.g., Hand, Foot, and Mouth Disease; Conjunctivitis) *Sexually transmitted disease (e.g., herpes, Syphilis, HIV and AIDS) *Other viruses, such as West Nile Virus *Parasitic infection (e.g., Lyme Disease) *Mycoplasma (a type of pneumonia) *Tuberculosis *Fungal infection *Bacterial Meningitis that has not been fully treated *Certain drugs *Autoimmune diseases (e.g., Sarcoidosis, Behcet's Disease) == Risk factors == These factors increase the chance of developing aseptic meningitis: *Being exposed to someone with a viral illness *Working in a daycare or healthcare setting *Having a compromised immune system *Taking certain drugs (e.g., non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs) *Being a child or teenager (affects children and teens more often than adults) Category:Diseases and disorders of the brain
title: Aseptic meningitis
